name: Bull Hole Wash
description:
Introduction

Another rugged WCC canyon requiring a high clearance vehicle, anchor building skills, and a lot of effort for the payoff.

  • We used retrievable anchors on all 3 drops, be prepared to do the same or build anchors.

Approach

From car park follow a faint road to the entrance drainage.

Descent

Up to 3 rappels under 100' and a "hole" lot of downclimbing and boulder hopping.

Exit

Exit up rim tank will require a confident climber, use of handlines, and some "figuring it out". If you get stuck at the head wall retrace your steps and locate the exit gully before the headwall on the left side as you are headed up and out.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

Route established by Eric Moorcroft, Cooper Smith, and Scott Beckstead no signs of anchors or prior exploration.

August 2023
